response_requirements.initial_response_description: Must acknowledge receipt within 1 business day; provide records or denial within reasonable time per agency policy (typically 3 business days)
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Reasonable period as defined in agency's public records policy; must be prompt
response_requirements.extension_notes: Reasonable time varies by request complexity; agency policy must specify response timeframe

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Cannot charge for search or retrieval time
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Actual cost of copying; varies by agency
fee_structure.advance_payment: May require advance payment for mailing costs

exemptions.description: Records pertaining to probation, parole, and sexually violent predator commitment proceedings
Records pertaining to adoption proceedings including contents of adoption files
Trial preparation records of public offices involved in civil litigation
Confidential law enforcement investigatory records and attorney work product
Information where disclosure would constitute unreasonable invasion of personal privacy
Law enforcement investigatory records for ongoing investigations
Trade secrets and confidential commercial information

appeal_process.first_level: Court of Common Pleas - Mandamus Action
appeal_process.first_level_notes: No administrative appeal; direct mandamus action in court of common pleas, supreme court, or court of appeals
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court costs and reasonable attorney fees awarded to prevailing requester
appeal_process.statutory_damages: Up to $1,000 ($100 per business day) if requester requested damages in written request

requester_requirements.identification_prohibited: Office may ask for identity but cannot limit access based on identity or intended use
requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Office cannot limit availability by requiring disclosure of identity or intended use unless specifically required by law
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written request not required; office may ask for written request to assist in locating records

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Person responsible for public records must be designated
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Must provide in format requested when feasible
agency_obligations.policy_required: Must adopt written public records policy specifying response timeframe
agency_obligations.training_required: All elected officials and designees must attend public records training
agency_obligations.assistance_required: Must help clarify ambiguous or overly broad requests

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields manually verified from official Ohio statute. Must acknowledge within 1 business day; provide records or denial within reasonable time per agency policy (ground truth indicates typically 3 business days). No search fees allowed - only actual copying costs. Statutory damages up to $1,000 available ($100/day). Attorney fees to prevailing requester. Written policy and official training required. Cannot limit access based on identity or intended use.
